name: Mike Paradinas
description: '''Michael Robert Paradinas''' (born 26 September 1971), better known by his stage name '''Î¼-Ziq''' (pronounced "music" or mu-zik), is an English [[electronic music]]ian from [[Wimbledon, London|Wimbledon]], [[London]]. He was associated with the electronic style [[intelligent dance music]] (IDM) during the 1990s, and recorded on [[Rephlex Records]] and Reflective Records. His critically acclaimed 1997 album, ''[[Lunatic Harness]]'', helped define the [[drill 'n' bass]] subgenre and was also his most successful release, selling over 100,000 copies. Paradinas founded the record label [[Planet Mu]], begun in 1995, where he has championed genres such as [[juke house|juke]], [[Intelligent dance music|IDM]] and [[footwork (genre)|footwork]].
